name: The Fool
description: The Fool is the first card in the tarot deck. He is a free spirit, unburdened by the past and unanxious about the future. The Fool is a card of new beginnings, opportunity, and potential. He is a symbol of the journey ahead, and the adventures that await.
uprightMeaning: Beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, a free spirit
reversedMeaning: Naivety, foolishness, recklessness, risk-taking, holding-back, inconsideration

name: The Magician
description: The Magician is the second card in the tarot deck. He is a master of the elements, and a symbol of power, creativity, and manifestation. The Magician is a card of action, and a reminder that we have the power to create our own reality.
reversedMeaning: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents, lack of direction

name: The High Priestess
description: The High Priestess is the third card in the tarot deck. She is a symbol of intuition, mystery, and the subconscious mind. The High Priestess is a card of wisdom, and a reminder to trust our inner voice and intuition.
uprightMeaning: Intuition, mystery, subconscious mind, wisdom, spirituality
reversedMeaning: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal and silence, lack of understanding

name: The Empress
description: The Empress is the fourth card in the tarot deck. She is a symbol of fertility, creativity, and abundance. The Empress is a card of nurturing, and a reminder to take care of ourselves and those around us.
reversedMeaning: Creative block, dependence on others, neglect, smothering

name: The Emperor
description: The Emperor is the fifth card in the tarot deck. He is a symbol of authority, structure, and control. The Emperor is a card of leadership, and a reminder to take charge of our lives and make decisions with confidence.
reversedMeaning: Domination, excessive control, lack of discipline, inflexibility

name: The Hierophant
description: The Hierophant is the sixth card in the tarot deck. He is a symbol of tradition, conformity, and spirituality. The Hierophant is a card of guidance, and a reminder to seek wisdom and knowledge from those who have come before us.
reversedMeaning: Rebellion, subversiveness, unconventional behavior, unorthodox beliefs

name: The Lovers
description: The Lovers is the seventh card in the tarot deck. It is a symbol of love, relationships, and choices. The Lovers is a card of harmony, and a reminder to follow our hearts and make decisions with love and compassion.
reversedMeaning: Self-love, disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values

name: The Chariot
description: The Chariot is the eighth card in the tarot deck. It is a symbol of victory, willpower, and determination. The Chariot is a card of progress, and a reminder to stay focused and move forward with confidence.
reversedMeaning: Self-discipline, lack of direction, aggression, defeat, failure

name: Strength
description: Strength is the ninth card in the tarot deck. It is a symbol of courage, inner strength, and self-control. Strength is a card of resilience, and a reminder to stay strong and face our fears with confidence.
uprightMeaning: Courage, inner strength, self-control, compassion, resilience
reversedMeaning: Weakness, self-doubt, lack of self-discipline, insecurity

name: The Hermit
description: The Hermit is the tenth card in the tarot deck. He is a symbol of introspection, solitude, and wisdom. The Hermit is a card of reflection, and a reminder to take time for ourselves and listen to our inner voice.
uprightMeaning: Introspection, solitude, wisdom, guidance, inner voice
reversedMeaning: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, self-discovery, inner guidance

name: Wheel of Fortune
description: The Wheel of Fortune is the eleventh card in the tarot deck. It is a symbol of destiny, change, and luck. The Wheel of Fortune is a card of opportunity, and a reminder to embrace the changes that come our way.
reversedMeaning: Bad luck, resistance to change, control, chaos, cycles

name: Justice
description: Justice is the twelfth card in the tarot deck. It is a symbol of fairness, balance, and truth. Justice is a card of accountability, and a reminder to take responsibility for our actions and decisions.
reversedMeaning: Unfairness, dishonesty, lack of accountability, injustice
